info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 28 at 3:43AM CDT until June 29 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Excessive Heat Warning today, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values over 110 expected. For the Heat Advisory, heat index values over 105 expected. * WHERE...Clark, Dallas, Ouachita and Calhoun Counties. * WHEN...For the Excessive Heat Warning today, from 1 PM this afternoon to 8 PM CDT this evening. For the Heat Advisory tomorrow, from noon to 8 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * WHAT: Expect heat index values near or above 105. * WHERE: Portions of central, north central, southwest and western Arkansas. * WHEN: From noon Wednesday to 8 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS: Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
